meanings.definition: To bring back up undigested or partially digested food from the stomach to the mouth.
meanings.sent1: After eating too quickly, the cat ended up regurgitating its food.
meanings.sent2: The bird was regurgitating food to feed its chicks.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to be regurgitating a magic trick as it brought back the treat from its stomach.
meanings.sent4: The volcano was regurgitating molten lava, creating a dangerous situation for the nearby village.
meanings.sent5: The image of the whale regurgitating a stream of fish was both fascinating and unsettling.

meanings.definition: To repeat information without analyzing or understanding it.
meanings.sent1: During the exam, he was regurgitating facts without really comprehending them.
meanings.sent2: The student was regurgitating the history lesson word for word.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was regurgitating jokes it had heard without knowing their meanings.
meanings.sent4: The radio host was regurgitating the news headlines without adding any new insights.
meanings.sent5: Her speech sounded like she was regurgitating a script, lacking genuine emotion.

meanings.definition: To give back or return something in a way that is not original or creative.
meanings.sent1: The artist was regurgitating the same ideas in his paintings, lacking innovation.
meanings.sent2: The company was regurgitating old marketing strategies that no longer worked.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was regurgitating old jokes, failing to entertain the audience.
meanings.sent4: The writer was regurgitating cliches in his novel, making it predictable.
meanings.sent5: The politician was regurgitating promises without any real plans for change.
